abstracts.cdata!:
This Result Profile focuses on
            rehabilitation of education, health and road infrastructure
            in Jamaica after passage of Hurricane Dean in August 2007.
            Hurricane Dean hit Jamaica in August 2007, causing extensive
            damage. Schools, health centers, and roads suffered most of
            the damage. From December 2007 to June 2011, World Bank
            project successfully rehabilitated seventy one facilities
            that felt the brunt of Hurricane Dean. The project design
            combined reconstruction of affected education, health, and
            roads facilities with capacity-building to strengthen local
            and national capacity for disaster risk management. Simple
            technologies such as hurricane straps in all the buildings,
            safety or sanitation features within school facilities and
            involvement of the local community through the creation of
            local maintenance committees were emphasized in the
            reconstruction of facilities. The project’s design
            incorporated measures to increase the sustainability of the
            investments. The local committees prepared and implemented a
            maintenance plan, promoted community awareness on the
            importance of adequate maintenance of public assets, and
            carried out measures to secure funding for maintenance
            through fundraising
